France's political crisis weakens French and European growth
subhead: Uncertainty stemming from political instability has cost France at least 0.2 percentage points of growth, according to its central bank. With economic stagnation in Germany and budget tensions in the UK, Europe's largest countries are in turmoil.

title: Amid the ruins of Gaza, Hamas celebrates the release of 2,000 Palestinian prisoners
Trump and leaders sign Gaza declaration in Egypt
US government shutdown could be 'one of the longest' ever, House Speaker Johnson warns
subhead: 'We're barreling toward one of the longest shutdowns in American history,' Speaker Mike Johnson said on Monday.  With no endgame in sight, the shutdown is expected to roll on for the unforeseeable future. Vice President JD Vance has warned of 'painful' cuts ahead, even as employee unions sue.

title: SpaceX launches the 11th test flight of its mega Starship rocket with another win
subhead: On Monday, it was the 11th test flight for a full-scale Starship, which SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk intends to use to send people to Mars. Instead of remaining inside Launch Control as usual, the billionaire said he was going outside to watch for the first time – 'much more visceral.'

title: In Switzerland, US tariffs are leaving industries at a loss
subhead: Two months after the implementation of a massive 39% customs tariff on many Swiss export products, affected Swiss companies have responded in scattered order.

title: Philippe Aghion, 2025 Nobel in economics laureate: 'The key factor of economic power is technological leadership'
subhead: The French economist was part of a trio that won the 2025 Economics Nobel Prize. In an interview, he argued that France and Europe must invest in innovation to maintain their status as economic powers.

title: Why foreigners love France but struggle with the French
subhead: While France captivates with its culture and lifestyle, the French, frequently caricatured as arrogant and impolite, often have a poor reputation. This ambivalence raises questions about the roots of anti-French sentiment abroad.

title: Paris's remarkable fashion week masks the luxury industry's headlong rush
subhead: By reigniting the dream machine, the so-called 'fashion week of the century' has signaled the rise of a new generation of designers – but without revealing anything about the intentions of the leaders of luxury conglomerates.
